meanings.definition: Moving or progressing at a pace slower than usual.
meanings.sent1: The turtle was overslow in crossing the road.
meanings.sent2: The snail was overslow in reaching the finish line.
meanings.sent3: The sloth's overslow movements entertained the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to pass overslow during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent5: The overslow traffic made everyone late for the meeting.

meanings.definition: To cause something to move or progress at a pace slower than usual.
meanings.sent1: He overslowed his speech to help the students understand better.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain overslowed the progress of the construction work.
meanings.sent3: She overslowed the game to annoy her competitive brother.
meanings.sent4: The fog overslowed the visibility on the road.
meanings.sent5: The old engine overslowed the entire production process.
